newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks dip on retail selling.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks dip on retail selling.

text.p: Dhaka stocks closed 29 points lower on Wednesday as retail investors took to the sideline ahead of next week's national budget, brokers said.
The benchmark index of the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) lost 2.47 percent or 29 points at 1,144.55 on a turnover of 72.5 million taka. Losers led gainers by 99 to 34.
Brokers said investors were unlikely to come up with any significant commitment before the budget due to be announced on June 12.
Shine Pukur Holdings lost 7.48 taka to 145.91 and Bangladesh Tobacco Co was down 4.69 to 145.35.
